title: 111_s2838
content: The Act titled "Rural Health Access and Improvement Act of 2009" prioritizes grants for hospital health information technology and expands participation in the Section 340B program. Section 340B(a)(4) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include children's hospitals and free-standing cancer hospitals excluded from the Medicare prospective payment system. Additionally, critical access hospitals are also included in the amendment. Entities eligible for certain benefits under the Public Health Service Act include critical access hospitals, rural referral centers, sole community hospitals, and rural health clinics as defined by the Social Security Act. GAO will conduct a study and report on dispensing fees. The Comptroller General of the United States will conduct a study on the cost of dispensing prescription drugs under Medicaid, considering costs related to pharmacists checking Medicaid coverage and conducting clinical review activities to reduce fraud and abuse. The pharmacy incurs costs associated with activities related to specific drugs, including adverse reactions, education on appropriate use, drug interactions, and quality assurance activities required by law. The pharmacy's costs related to Medicaid-covered drugs include measuring, mixing, filling containers, transferring prescriptions to patients, special packaging, overhead costs, maintenance, salaries of pharmacy staff, and geographic operational factors. The text discusses factors affecting operational costs for pharmacies dispensing Medicaid-covered drugs, including geographic factors, compounding prescriptions, and uncollectability of copayments. It also mentions variations in costs based on pharmacy location, specialty products, and long-term care facilities. Additionally, it mentions the need for increased dispensing fees to incentivize pharmacists to promote alternative therapies. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report to the Secretary of Health and Human Services and each State by December 1, 2010, detailing a study on Medicaid prescription drug costs. States must use this report to evaluate Medicaid pharmacy dispensing adequacy. The Comptroller General will submit a report on Medicaid prescription drug costs by December 1, 2010. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will use this report to approve State plan amendments for increasing Medicaid pharmacy dispensing fees. Section 338J of the Public Health Service Act is amended by striking subsection (k) regarding State Offices of Rural Health.
